title: Learning Disjunctions of Predicates
abstract: Let $F$ be a set of boolean functions. We present an algorithm for learning $F_\vee := \{\vee_{f\in S} f \mid S \subseteq F\}$ from membership queries. Our algorithm asks at most $|F| \cdot OPT(F_\vee)$ membership queries where $OPT(F_\vee)$ is the minimum worst case number of membership queries for learning $F_\vee$. When $F$ is a set of halfspaces over a constant dimension space or a set of variable inequalities, our algorithm runs in polynomial time.
